sub_title: Digital | Innovation | AI Data Analytics | Business Development | Maritime | Start-up | Technology Strategy | Consultancy | Software as a Service | Sales
summary:
My passion is to connect technology with business by combining technical understanding with strategic impact.
•	Strong technical background (PhD in Physics) with post graduate business education.
•	20+ years working experience combining strategy consulting, technology and innovation.
•	Experienced leader and strategy consultant in technology intensive industries.

I am performance-driven with a track record of combining sharp analytics and sound logic with a pragmatic approach to deliver concrete results.
•	Good interpersonal and communication skills to bridge the gap between technical and commercial settings.
•	Maintain helicopter view and align technology roadmap into concrete and pragmatic actions.
•	Translate technology, strategy and innovation into business impact and set strategic priorities.

As leader of innovation, I have ample experience in driving, coaching and facilitating innovation, technology development and strategic business development.
•	Entrepreneurial approach with strong communication skills to establish strategic partnerships with customers and suppliers.
•	Clients and colleagues describe me as reliable, analytical and result oriented, ensuring timely and quality deliverables.
•	Build, coach and develop accountable teams in complex environments to align different disciplines on joint objectives.

I am self-motivated with broad general knowledge and an international mind set. I thrive in a dynamic, international environment with technology as driver for change. I am curious, constantly seeking new learning opportunities and exploring new ventures.

Publications:
- "Innovation in the Maritime Industry", R&D Innovation Excellence Summit, Amsterdam April 14, 2016
- "The impact of digitization in the maritime industry", annual meeting Danske Maritime, April 20, 2016
-"The Data Drive" Maersk Post July 2014

Focus: Technology, Innovation, Strategy, Technical Business Development, Acquisitions, Big Data Analytics

jasper@zarastro.nl  | +31 625067164

treasury_media.title: The impact of digitization in the maritime industry", annual meeting Danske Maritime, April 20, 2016
"Innovation in the Maritime Industry", R&D Innovation Excellence, Amsterdam, April 2016
treasury_media.description: Research and Development (R&D) is a key factor that contributes to the success of any business. However, the outcome of R&D is highly uncertain. Organisations face some important dilemmas/challenges while planning and managing their R&D activities. Return on R&D investment and the impact of R&D spending on long-term growth and competitiveness is dependent on the existence of sound R&D management.

profile_positions.description:
Portchain applies artificial intelligence to optimize asset utilization for container terminals and carriers. We focus on solving the hardest planning problems in shipping. Learn more on portchain.com or contact me for a demo to see what we can do for your operations.

Strengthen the commercial team to drive strategic engagement with customers:
- Commercial strategy
- Customer (future) requirements
- Entire sales funnel: prospect - demo - proposal - pilot - contract
- End-to-end sales process and negotiations
- Consultative selling
profile_positions.title: Senior Director Sales
Owner & Independent Advisor | Technology | Innovation | Strategy | Digital | Business Dev | Maritime
Sr Advisor | Account Business Development | Innovation | Fleet Technology | Digital Twin | Growth

profile_positions.description:
NAVIS is the global market leader in building and implementing enterprise software that is at the heart of running a container terminal and services to optimize shipping operations around the world. Navis’ latest projects involve advanced algorithms, data analytics (big data), innovative new technologies and applications. NAVIS is leading the way in automation and optimization in the maritime industry to further optimise shipping operations.

Main responsibilities:
- Engage with key clients at Executive level to (further) improve relationship.
- Assess client’s strategy, future needs and identify innovation opportunities at corporate level.
- Develop and execute strategic key account plans with cross functional and regional teams.
- Lead a cross functional teams within Navis to ensure quality and further improve client relationship.

Key focus: Strategic Account Management, Technology and Innovation Management, Strategic Collaboration, Data Analytics (Big Data), Automation and Digital Strategy.
profile_positions.title: Director Strategic Key Accounts | Supplier Partnerships | Business Development | Port Technology

profile_positions.description:
Maersk Maritime Technology is an engineering consultancy unit with some 140 engineers and (internal) project sales of ca. USD 20 million within the Maersk Group. The strategic R&D department monitors emerging technology to assess their potential impact for the business and executes multi-disciplinary innovation projects to explore, verify and mature new technologies together with key clients and supplier.

Main responsibilities
- Member of the MMT management team, responsible for the innovation activities.
- 6 direct and 12 indirect reports of the MMT innovation team across technical disciplines.
- Align innovation process and project portfolio across technical disciplines and with customers.
- Manage strategic partnerships with suppliers to drive joint innovation agenda.
- Facilitate Technical Innovation Board meetings with 12 Chief Technology Officers of the different Maersk Business Units and co-ordinate the USD 10 million Group Innovation Fund.

Key achievements
- Established and kicked off the newly formed Technical Innovation Board (mid 2015) and facilitate bi-monthly, full day meetings to discuss innovation strategy across the Maersk Group.
- Kick started the new USD 10 million Group Innovation Fund with 5 concrete, strategic innovation projects and ‘Proof of Concepts’ to assess technical business development opportunities.
- Led a Maersk Drilling project on Big Data Analytics and Predictive Maintenance, identifying USD 100-150 million annual cost saving and strategic implementation roadmap.
- Drove Maersk’s participation to establish joint industry collaboration of USD 7.5 million, 15 innovation projects and 40 strategic suppliers and universities.
- Redesigned and implemented LEAN innovation process to focus and align innovation activities.
- Established strategic partnerships with key suppliers and identified joint innovation projects.

Key focus: Technology Strategy, Innovation Management, Strategic Partnerships, Big Data Analytics, Digital Strategy
profile_positions.title: Director Innovation and Future Technology | Strategic Supplier Partnership | Maritime Techology

profile_positions.description:
Danfoss is one of the largest industrial companies in Denmark, with more than 23,000 employees and net sales of around USD 5.8 billion. Danfoss is a global company and leader in research, development and production of industrial components in refrigeration, heating, power electronics and drives.

Main responsibilities
- Overall responsible for Corporate Strategy and M&A competence centre.
- Build new team of 6 direct reports and coach strategic development.
- Manage the annual strategic planning process to align future strategic direction of each division.
- Conduct strategy projects with senior management at divisional and/or business unit level.
- Ensure quality of M&A-proposals and warrant strategic acquisition rationale.

Key achievements
- Identified new business opportunities of building energy efficiency services. Multi-disciplinary inputs were consolidated into a pragmatic business plan and clear go-to market strategy.
- Portfolio analysis to prioritise investments and aligned strategic development of circa 40 business segments within the Heating Solution to create transparency.
- Coached the team organising the annual ‘Man on the Moon’ innovation competition, identifying 10 potential new business ventures across the company.
- Assess potential to consolidate production and partly outsource production of solenoid valves to a strategic supplier.
- Strategy for the High Pressure Pump segment to identify and prioritize strategic growth options.

Key focus: Business and Technology Strategy, Portfolio Management, Technical Business Development, Innovation
profile_positions.title: Vice President Strategy Mergers & Acquisitions | Technology | Portfolio | New Business | Innovation

profile_positions.description:
Reed Business is a division of Reed Elsevier –a leading global publisher with sales USD 8 million– focused on professional business to business information and transforming into new digital segments. Reed Business has a global turnover of USD 3.4 billion. In the Netherlands, Reed Business has some 1.200 staff and more than USD 400 million sales.

Main responsibilities
- Overall responsibility for annual strategy plan, reporting to the CEO and align internally.
- Drive internal new business development, innovation process and strategic projects.
- Lead strategic acquisition process to identify and evaluate ‘fill in’ acquisition targets.
- Direct report of 1 strategy manager and 2 consultants and project teams (usually around 4).

Key achievements
- Evaluated approx. 50 potential acquisition targets, resulting in 9 proposals to HQs with typical acquisition price between USD 2 – 15 million.
- Initiated a series of ‘Innovation Action Labs’ to work-out innovative business ideas in 2 days, leading to concrete, new ideas that were implemented within the existing organisation.
- Quantified strategic 5 years online growth plan of USD 111 million (+164%), based on the gap analysis, the board decided to invest in a dedicated innovation team and strategic acquisitions.
- Strategic portfolio analysis of opportunities of a business unit, identifying and concretising USD 10 million growth potential.

Key focus: Growth Strategy, Acquisitions, Innovation, Technology & Digital Development, Strategic Portfolio Management, Business Development
profile_positions.title: Manager Acquisitions & Business Development | Digital Transformation  | Technology Strategy | Growth

profile_positions.description:
Arthur D. Little is a global Management Consultancy focusing on strategy, technology and innovation management. Typical projects advise at board level on strategic business challenges with a strong technical component. The Rotterdam office consisted of approx. 80 consultants with an excellent track record in technology intensive industries.

Main responsibilities
- Manage typical projects of circa 10 weeks with a team of 10 persons (5 ADL / 5 client staff). Projects were commissioned at board level and actively involved clients’ senior management.
- Quickly advanced from analyst to project manager, actively contributing to develop new strategic methodologies, international studies and articles on Technology and Innovation management.
 
Key achievements
- Post-merger integration to combine 7 existing research facilities into a new technology institute. I led the team to define the combined technology roadmap and strategic developments.
- Strategy of the expansion of the Port of Busan (South Korea), based on a benchmark of value added logistics activities of the ports of Rotterdam, Singapore and Shanghai.
- Technology audit of a technology institute, based on a fact-based technology impact assessment, international comparison and discussions with international experts.
- Business plan –financial cash flow analysis and competence development- of a new business venture of a telecom operator.
- International Global innovation Excellence study, identifying best practices and success factors of technology and innovation management, based on 800+ surveys of Chief Technology Officers.

Key focus: Technology and Innovation Strategy, Telecom, Due Diligence ( Acquisitions), Growth Strategy, Technical Business Development, Strategic Management of Technologies.
profile_positions.title: Manager Strategy | Technology | Innovation | Industry | Transformation | Growth | Consulting

profile_positions.description:
Physics Department: research to the control of human arm movements by the human Central Nervous System. Resulting in a PhD thesis "Moving two hands: common versus independent control" graduation on June 21, 1999.

Key focus: Applied Physics, Technology Engineering
profile_positions.title: PhD Research | Technology Application | Applied Physics | Data Modeling | Statistics
